label: Physical description
value: Etching and engraving on off-white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 80 and 81)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Title Page, Oeuvre de François de Cuvilliés père et fils (Works of François de Cuvilliés the Elder and the Younger)

label: Description
value: Title page by an anonymous designer for a miscellaneous volume with prints after François de Cuvilliés the Elder and the Younger.  Ornamental text within a decorated frame topped with an armorial trophy.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Crowning Elements, Groups of Figures, Ecclesiastical Trophy

label: Description
value: A large figural group within an architectural interior. At upper left, a winged putto holding a shield, below which is a lion and an angel holding a portrait of a man. Additional figures throughout in classical style.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Plan of a garden and garden buildings. An extensive key to letters A-Q figures in the print on the right. Lower left and right are perspective views of part of the building and the garden. In the view at lower left, a group of dancing drinking putti figures, some playing music.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Architecture Propre A Differens Usages (Architecture for Different Uses), plate from Oeuvres de François de Cuvilliés, fils

label: Description
value: Print of various usages of architectural ornaments with skulls, putti, short fluted column with urn. Above, male and female gazing at each other with barrels pouring out water.

label: Physical description
value: Etching and engraving on white laid paper

label: Dimensions
value: Sheet: 37.3 x 25.4 cm (14 11/16 in. x 10 in.) Platemark: 21 x 15.5 cm (8 1/4 x 6 1/8 in.)

value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Architecture propre a differens usages (Architecture for Different Uses), from Suite DD of Cahiers of Jean Charles Delafosse

label: Description
value: Tower with horizontal panels topped with light. Scale at the bottom.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Bound volume of 6 ornamental grosteque etchings.

label: Physical description
value: Bound volume of engravings on paper

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Title plate of a series of six numbered plates. Symmetrically-designed panel with grotesques, including two horn-blowing children standing on an eagle at lower center. Ornamental decoration includes birds, garlands, and flowers.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Plate 2 of a series of 6 numbered plates. Symmetrically-designed panel with grotesques. At lower center, a mask, with ribbons at its eyes connecting it to the body of a herm at center; the figure's tail forms two cartouches, upon which hang a leopard and lion. Circular medallion at upper center, above which two putti kiss. Ornamental decorations include festoons of flowers.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Plate 3 of a series of 6 numbered plates. Symmetrically-designed panel with grotesques. At center, two humanoid figures support with their outstretched hands a platter upon which a woman stands at left and a man stands at right. At lower left and right, two monkeys occupy circular cartouches; another pair of monkeys stands above the forms. Ornamental decorations include festoons of flowers, lamps, and borders.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Plate 4 of a series of 6 numbered plates. Symmetrically-designed panel with grotesques. At lower center, two grotesque putti figures with swirling cartouche tails support a platter upon which stands a decorated vase with a mask at center. On either side of the vase, large swan-like birds emit water in streams from their beaks. Above, two putti hold onto branches contained within the vase. Ornamental decorations include festoons of flowers and female figures with a string of fish.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 5, Vénus ou La Coquetterie (Venus or Vanity), Arabesques (Arabesques)

label: Description
value: Plate 5 of a series of 6 numbered plates. Symmetrically-designed panel with grotesques. At lower center, two grotesque putti, cartouches at their tails. Above, a pleated fan, upon which sit two kissing birds. Architectural structures with bases and columns at left and right, above which sit two sphinxes, each holding a hand mirror; an oval medallion with three nude female figures in between. Ornamental decorations include festoons of flowers.

label: Dimensions
value: 26 x 18.5 cm (10 1/4 x 7 5/16 in.) Platemark/repeat:  15.9 x 11.5 cm (6 1/4 x 4 1/2 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 6, Mars ou La Guerre (Mars or War), Arabesques (Arabesques)

label: Description
value: Plate 6 of a series of 6 numbered plates. Symmetrically-designed panel with grotesques. At lower center, two crossed swords in shields over an ax. Swirling cartouches made of garlands at either side with sphinxes above. At upper center, two grotesque putti wearing battle helmets and carrying shields--crossed arrows at left and right. Ornamental decorations include armor, weapons, and symbols of war.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Almanac for the First Half of the Year 1778, with Portraits of the Royal French Family

label: Description
value: A frieze with six portraits in helf length is on top. The portraits r epresent kind "LOUIS XVI" (1751-1793); queen Marie Antoinette, "LA REINE" (1754-1793); Louis XVIII (1755-1824), "MONSIEUR": his wife Marie Louise of Savoy, "MADAME"; the Count of Artois, later Charles X (1757-1836), "Mr Le Cte D'ARTOIZ"; his wife, "Me LA Csse D'ARTOIS".

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Design for rocaille silver, serving dish.  Asymmetric in form with two, twisting handles.  Ornamented with root vegetables set in looping, lettuce and shell-like border.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Léon Decloux

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Les Plans (The Designs), plate 100, in Elements d'Orfevrerie (Elements of Goldsmithing), Second Part

value: Diagram of designs in outline of all metalwork.

Buirre pour les Évèque (Ewer for Bishops), plate 18, in Elements d'Orfevrerie (Elements of Goldsmithing), First Part

label: Description
value: Pitcher made of shells and plants; spout has mask and foot made of sea creature.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Pot à Sucre (Sugar Bowl) and Sallière à deux (Double Salt Cellar), plate 53, in Elements d'Orfevrerie (Elements of Goldsmithing), Second Part

label: Description
value: Two objects: lower, double bowl made by large shells with lids, an X above a shield with stars and crown divides the bowls. Above, tureen with gourd-like appearance with shell-shaped lid and finial made of flowers. Foot is a shell.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Moutardier (Mustard Pot), plate 60, in Elements d'Orfevrerie (Elements of Goldsmithing), Second Part

label: Description
value: Pot made completely out of shells and feathery leaves; finial made of leaves; handle of one feathery leaf.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Pot à Oille (Soup Tureen), plate 78, in Elements d'Orfevrerie (Elements of Goldsmithing), Second Part

label: Description
value: Tureen body, foot (shaped like fishtail), and lid made of shells ornamented with various kinds of leaves, handles made of twisted vines. At center, a crown and finial made of a plumed helmet, alongside a headless fish and arrows.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Terrine (Tureen), plate 80, in Elements d'Orfevrerie (Elements of Goldsmithing), Second Part

label: Description
value: Tureen made of shell, with leaves for feet with cabbage and mushroom finial. Central ornament topped with crown.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Cabares (Teapot), plate 84, in Elements d'Orfevrerie (Elements of Goldsmithing), Second Part

label: Description
value: Teapot made of shells with floral finial, supported by four curved legs. Below, sugar bowl made with shell and four cups.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Pot à l'eau (Water Pitcher), plate 98, in Elements d'Orfevrerie (Elements of Goldsmithing), Second Part

label: Description
value: Pitcher made of shells and rinceaux wrapped around, with partial crown on right.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Two Designs for Ewer-shaped Ornaments, Album of Ornament

label: Description
value: Two designs epitomizing the fantastical asymmetric rococo spirit, possibly to be produced in gold or silver. At left, a vase-like form decorated with shell motifs, acanthus leaves and c- and s-scrolls. At right, an ewer form decorated with shell, leave and c- and s-scrolls. Two auricular fragments are placed between the two objects.

label: Physical description
value: Etching, engraving on white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Jean Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Singeries ou differentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Bound volume of 22 prints and 1 loose print featuring monkeys in human costume acting out various scenes.

label: Physical description
value: Bound volume of etchings on paper

label: Provenance
value: Jean Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 1, Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Plate 1 of a series of 23. Title plate for an album of prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. Large winged rocaille escutcheon with shell motifs at center, upon which is printed the book’s title. At left, a kneeling monkey wearing pince-nez with paintbrush and palette adds the album’s title to the cartouche. Above the wing at left, the upper body of a monkey visible, wearing a feathered hat. At right, another monkey figure crouching behind the title. He wears a pointed hat and holds a cup or portion of bread upside down on a flat stone. Beside him is an amphora of wine and a butter knife.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

Plate 8, Le Lavement Rendu (The Enema Delivered), Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Plate 8 of a series of 23 prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. In an outdoor setting, three monkey figures in human costume. Following the delivery of an enema in 1921-6-319-9, a monkey at left sits upon a circular stand, excreting liquid diarrhea onto the ground. He rests his right foot on a pot of liquid at left and turns toward the viewer. At right, another monkey rushes with a blanket or towel. A third monkey squats on the ground with a concerned expression, facing right.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

Plate 9, Les Paniers de Chasse (The Hunting Baskets), Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Plate 9 of a series of 23 prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. In outdoor setting, a figure of a monkey in human costume riding on the back of a hunting dog. He holds the dog's leash in his right hand and a dead bird in his left. At the dog's side is a lined basket for storing the catch.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

Plate 10, Le Maître de Cors de Chasse (The Master of the Hunting Horn), Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Plate 10 of a series of 23 prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. In outdoor setting, two figures of monkeys dressed in human hunting costume, each kneeling on the ground. Monkey at left wears a feathered cap and faces to the right. He supports with each of his hands the body of a circular musical instrument (horn). Monkey at right blows into the horn.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

Plate 11, Le Maître Peintre (The Master Painter), Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Tricks or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Plate 11 of a series of 23 prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. Figure of a monkey in gentleman's clothing at center kneels upon a stool with an upholstered cushion before a canvas on an easel. He holds an artist's palette and applies a paintbrush to it. At left, another monkey in a hat rolls out a section of clay upon a flat surface at the top of a barrel. A jug and bucket appear at lower left.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 12, Le Branle (The Branle), Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Plate 12 of a series of 23 prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. In outdoor setting, a group of monkey figures in human costume, both men and women, many of the men wearing elaborate feathered hats. They dance the Branle, popular in the 18th century, linking hands and turning in a circle.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 4, La Ptisanier (The Herbal Tea Seller), Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Plate 4 of a series of 23 prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. In outdoor setting, a figural group of monkeys in human costume. At center, a monkey in a feathered hat wears a container of infused herbal tea at his back, with a long tube to dispense and deliver the beverage. He holds a conical chalice in his right hand. A smaller monkey at right with a stool on his back fills a small bowl with the drink. In the background, a cowering dog defecates.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Plate 3, L'Oiseau de Proye (The Bird of Prey), Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Plate 3 of a series of 23 prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. In an outdoor environment, a figure of a monkey in gentleman's costume at left. He wears a hat and holds a walking stick, his arms gesticulating widely. At his feet, a small falcon or hawk attacks a large goose or crane, who cries out. The monkey observes the birds.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

Plate 6, Le Maître à Dancer (The Dancing Master), Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Plate 6 of a series of 23 prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. Two monkey figures dancing, the animal at left is nude, while the monkey at right is dressed in elaborate court costume, including a sword at his hip, a sash, and a large feathered hat. He holds the hand of his partner, instructing him in the dance steps. In his left hand, he holds a violin and bow.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

Plate 7, Le Maître d'Armes (The Master of Arms), Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Plate 7 of a series of 23 prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. Two monkey figures in gentleman's costume engaged in a fencing lesson, the monkey in the background demonstrating correct form by holding his student's arm in the correct position. The master wears a hat and also holds a scabbard. In the foreground, a sword and a pair of shoes.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

Plate 8, Le Maître de Musique (The Music Master), Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Plate 8 of a series of 23 prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. In outdoor setting, a figural scene of a music lesson, the monkey instructor in gentleman's costume teaching his students, who are cats. The monkey holds a sheet of music in his left hand and a scroll in his right hand, directing his pupils. He has a violin strapped across his body. At his feet, one cat holds a sheet of music and looks up at his instructor. The other cat at center plays a dulcimer.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Dedication to Monsieur de L'Orme, Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Dedication plate from a series of 23 bound prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. Textual plate with printed text divided into two columns separated by a vertical line. Bordering the text is a menagerie of animals including birds such as a chicken, duck, goose, parrot, ostrich, and other exotic birds. At lower center, a resting lion, tiger, and leopard. Surrounding the animals are decorative columns and ornament in rocaille style.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Le Sculpteur (The Sculptor), Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Plate from a series of 23 prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. In an artist's studio setting, a figure of a monkey in gentleman's costume using a hammer and chisel to sculpt a portrait bust of a female monkey. At right, another monkey assists. Sculptor's tools, vase, pitcher, and bowl in foreground.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

Plate 10, Le Tambour de Basque (The Tambourine), Singeries ou différentes actions de la vie humaine représentées par des singes (Monkey Antics or Different Actions of Human Life Represented by Monkeys)

label: Description
value: Plate 10 of a series of 23 prints featuring monkeys acting as humans in various figural scenes. In an outdoor setting with trees and a garden wall, a monkey figure in human costume dances and plays the tambourine.

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1921: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
